Editor's note— Ord. No. 2000-13, § IX, adopted April 4, 2000, repealed § 10-1-94 in its entirety. Former § 10-1-94 pertained to heating, ventilating and air conditioning license fees and derived from the 1958 Code, §§ 6-90, 6-92. 
Sec. 10-1-95. - Heating, ventilating and air conditioning permit fees. 
(a)  Definitions. For the purpose of heating, ventilating and air conditioning permit fees, the following are defined: 
(1)  In general. Where terms are not defined in this section, they shall have their ordinarily accepted meanings or such as the context may imply. 
(2)  Air conditioning equipment. Air conditioning equipment shall mean refrigeration units used for comfort cooling and installed for central air conditioning systems or self-contained air conditioning units. 
(3)  Approved gas appliance. Approved gas appliance means gas appliances tested, approved, listed and bearing the seal of approval of a nationally recognized testing agency. 
(4)  Distribution system. Distribution system shall mean a system designed and constructed for the purpose of conveying steam, water or air for heating, conditioning or process purposes. 
(5)  Gas vent. Gas vent means a vertical flue for removing products of combustion from approved gas appliances requiring a draft hood, but not suitable for other fuels. 
(6)  Horsepower capacity of refrigeration units. All reference to horsepower capacity of refrigeration units shall be construed to mean the horsepower rating of the compressor motor only. Capacity of other than compressed units shall be based on the refrigeration tonnage rating of the unit, at forty (40) degree evaporator and one hundred five (105) degrees condensing temperature, or equivalent. One (1) ton of refrigeration under these conditions shall be considered equal to one (1) horsepower. 
(7)  Mechanical firing equipment. Mechanical firing equipment shall mean a device for feeding and burning of solid, liquid and gaseous fuels, such as gas and oil conversion burners and stokers. 
(8)  Multifamily house. Multifamily house means a building occupied as the home or residence of individuals, families or households living independently of each other, of which three (3) or more are doing cooking within their apartments; including tenement house, apartment house or flat. 
(b)  Schedule of permit fees. 
(1)  Boiler or furnace. Permit fees for the installation of each boiler or furnace including distribution system, when such distribution system is installed under same permit as boiler or furnace, shall be in accordance with Schedule (A) below. 
(2)  Floor furnace, wall circulator, etc. Permit fees for the installation of each floor furnace, wall circulator or heater, recessed wall circulator or heater, (vented circulating heater), direct fired unit heater, gas steam radiator, commercial, rotary dryer direct fired, blast furnace and annealing furnaces shall be in accordance with Schedule (A) below. 
(3)  Replacement boiler or furnace. Permit fees for the installation of each replacement boiler or furnace connected to existing system, or installed and connected to distribution system installed by others under separate permit and mechanical firing equipment, shall be in accordance with Schedule (A) below. 
(4)  Distribution system. Permit fees for the installation or replacement of distribution system connecting to existing boilers or furnaces, or the installation or replacement of distribution system installed and connected to boilers or furnaces installed by others under separate permit shall be in accordance with Schedule (A) below. 
(5)  Refrigeration units. Permit fees for the installation of each refrigeration unit including distribution system, condenser, receiver, cooling tower or evaporative condenser, coils and air handling unit shall be in accordance with Schedule (B) below. Permit fees for the installation of separate refrigeration units or distribution systems installed under separate permits, including both new and replacement installations shall be in accordance with Schedule (B). 
(6)  Hoods over restaurant type ranges, etc. Permit fees for the installation of holds over restaurant type ranges, candy kettles, cruller furnaces and appliances for frying, barbecuing, broiling of meats, bakery or confectionery products shall be in accordance with section (c). 
(7)  Ventilating system other than in one- or two-family residence. Permit fees for the installation of ventilating system other than in a one- or two-[family] residence shall be in accordance with Schedule (D). 
(8)  Vertical gas vents, metal smokestacks, etc. Permit fees for the installation of ventilating system other than in a one-or two-family residence shall be in accordance with Schedule (E). 
(9)  Total connected load. The permit fee schedule shall be confined to the total connected load which shall include a one (1) unit each single family residence. Each tenant unit in duplexes, tenant unit in multi-family residences, each tenant space commercial establishments, each tenant space apartment house, each tenant space institution or industrial plant. 
(10)  Gas hot water heaters. Permit fees for the replacement of gas hot heaters shall be in accordance with Schedule (F) below: 
Permit Fee Schedule (A)  Heating Systems 

 
Plus $100.00 per million over 4,000,000 
Permit Fee Schedule (B)  Cooling Systems 

 
Plus $1.50 per ton over 100 tons 
Permit Fee Schedule (C)  Grease Hoods 

 
Permit Fee Schedule (D)  Fans 

 
Permit Fee Schedule (E)  Vents, Stacks & Chimneys 

 
Permit Fee Schedule (F)  Water Heater 

 
(11)  Special. Permit fees for the installation of the following equipment shall be: 
a.  Circulating air blowers on existing heating equipment, thirty dollars ($30.00) each. 
b.  Commercial incinerators and barbecue pits, including vents or stacks, thirty dollars ($30.00) each. 
c.  Residential incinerators, including vent or stacks, thirty dollars ($30.00) each. 
d.  Combustion air or induced draft fans, thirty dollars ($30.00) each. 
e.  Duct alteration, thirty dollars ($30.00). 
f.  Change of contractor/company, thirty dollars ($30.00). 
(12)  For issuing each permit, a minimum fee of thirty dollars ($30.00) will be charged. 
(c)  Penalty fee. There shall be a penalty of double the price of the permit, in addition to the permit fee, if the permit is not acquired before beginning of work. 
(d)  Re-inspection fees. When the owner or contractor calls for an inspection and the inspector finds that the work is not ready for inspection, a re-inspection fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for the first re-inspection and fifty dollars ($50.00) for each subsequent re-inspection will be assessed. All re-inspection fees shall be paid prior to next inspection of said work. 
(Ord. No. 89-64, § I(b), 10-2-89; Ord. No. 93-30, § III, 6-15-93; Ord. No. 93-40, § III, 8-3-93; Ord. No. 2000-13, § X, 4-4-00; Ord. No. 2012-11, §§ IV, V, 5-1-12)
